```{R}

### Load libraries

library(ggplot2)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)

```

```{R}

### Read the file for outcomes of care measures

outcome <- read.csv("outcome-of-care-measures.csv", colClasses = "character")
head(outcome)

```

```{R}
### information about the file

ncol(outcome)
names(outcome)

```

```{R}

### simple histogram of the 30-day death rates from Heart Attack (Column 11)
###NAs are OK at this stage

outcome[, 11] <- as.numeric(outcome[, 11])
hist(outcome[, 11])

```

```{R}
### Let's make it pretty --> BASIC FUNCTION
  ### main = title
  ### xlab = x axis name
  ### xlim = range on the x axis
  ### ylim = range on the y axis
  ### col = fill of the bar
  ### border = border of the bar

hist(outcome[, 11],
     main = "Heart Attack 30-Day Mortality Rate",
     xlab = "Deaths",
     xlim = c(5,25),
     ylim = c(0,800),
     col = "pink",
     border ="purple")

```

```{R}
### let's make it pretty --> WITH GGPLOT2

### Change name of column to the x axis name

HA <- data.frame(outcome[,11])
colnames(HA)[1] <- "Deaths"

### Run ggplot2
  ### bins = numer of columns
  ### colour = border of the bin
  ### fill = fill of the bin
  ### labs = title and axis names

g <- ggplot(HA, aes = (x = Deaths)) 
g + 
  geom_histogram(HA, 
                   mapping = aes(x = Deaths),
                   bins = 39,
                   colour = "purple",
                   fill = "pink") +
  labs(title = "Heart Attack 30 Day Mortality Rate", x = "Deaths", y = "Frequency")


```
